title: manymome.table
text: article brief illustration convert results package manymome (Cheung & Cheung, 2023) publication-ready tables using functions manymome.table. assumes readers used manymome. guide focus converting results using as_flextable() method.

title: manymome.table
text: example article used, modifications. sample data set manymome: Th following model fitted lavaan: Use all_indirect_paths() identify indirect paths: Estimate indirect effects, bootstrap confidence intervals. method as_flextable() can used convert output flextable. use method, need load package manymome.table first. Path Effect Std. Effect 95% CI SE x → m1 → m2 → y 0.25 0.12 [0.02 , 0.22] 0.05 x → m1 → y -0.34 -0.16 [-0.31 , -0.04] 0.07 x → m2 → y -0.12 -0.06 [-0.21 , 0.02] 0.05 x → .. → y -0.21 -0.10 [-0.29 , 0.04] 0.07 Note: CI = confidence interval; paths '..' total indirect effects; Std. Effect completely standardized effect. default, standardized effects requested, unstandardized effects also printed converting flextable. demonstrated due speed concern, also supports output confidence intervals. See help(as_flextable.indirect_list) information options available conversion.
code: library(manymome) dat <- data_serial print(head(dat), digits = 3) #>       x   m1    m2     y        c1   c2 #> 1 12.12 20.6  9.33  9.00  0.109262 6.01 #> 2  9.81 18.2  9.47 11.56 -0.124014 6.42 #> 3 10.11 20.3 10.05  9.35  4.278608 5.34 #> 4 10.07 19.7 10.17 11.41  1.245356 5.59 #> 5 11.91 20.5 10.05 14.26 -0.000932 5.34 #> 6  9.13 16.5  8.93 10.01  1.802727 5.91 library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-16 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. mod_med <- " m1 ~ x m2 ~ m1 + x y ~ m2 + m1 + x " fit_med <- sem(model = mod_med,                data = dat,                fixed.x = TRUE) all_paths <- all_indirect_paths(fit = fit_med,                                 x = "x",                                 y = "y") all_paths #> Call:  #> all_indirect_paths(fit = fit_med, x = "x", y = "y") #> Path(s):  #>   path               #> 1 x -> m1 -> m2 -> y #> 2 x -> m1 -> y       #> 3 x -> m2 -> y # R set to 100 just for illustration. # Use 5000 or 10000 and set parallel to TRUE in real research. out_all <- many_indirect_effects(paths = all_paths,                                  fit = fit_med,                                  standardized_x = TRUE,                                  standardized_y = TRUE,                                  boot_ci = TRUE,                                  R = 100,                                  seed = 12345,                                  parallel = FALSE,                                  progress = FALSE) out_all #>  #> ==  Indirect Effect(s) (Both x-variable(s) and y-variable(s) Standardized)  == #>                       std  CI.lo  CI.hi Sig #> x -> m1 -> m2 -> y  0.119  0.016  0.223 Sig #> x -> m1 -> y       -0.163 -0.307 -0.039 Sig #> x -> m2 -> y       -0.058 -0.208  0.024     #>  #>  - [CI.lo to CI.hi] are 95.0% percentile confidence intervals by #>    nonparametric bootstrapping with 100 samples. #>  - std: The standardized indirect effects. #> library(manymome.table) ft_all <- as_flextable(out_all) ft_all

title: manymome.table
text: example article used, modifications. sample data set `manymome: illustration, OLS regression used instead structural equation modeling fit model: Compute conditional indirect effects: method as_flextable() can used convert output flextable. Path:  x → m → y [w1] [w2] (w1) (w2) Effect Std. Effect 95% CI SE M+1.0SD M+1.0SD 6.17 4.04 0.41 0.41 [0.11 , 0.68] 0.15 M+1.0SD M-1.0SD 6.17 2.06 0.18 0.18 [-0.02 , 0.44] 0.11 M-1.0SD M+1.0SD 4.04 4.04 0.12 0.12 [-0.09 , 0.39] 0.12 M-1.0SD M-1.0SD 4.04 2.06 0.05 0.05 [-0.04 , 0.20] 0.07 Note: [w] meaning level moderator 'w'; (w) value level moderator 'w': CI = confidence interval; Std. Effect completely standardized effect. default, standardized effects requested, unstandardized effects also printed converting flextable. demonstrated due speed concern, also supports output confidence intervals. See help(as_flextable.cond_indirect_effects) information options available conversion.
code: dat <- data_med_mod_ab print(head(dat), digits = 3) #>       x   w1   w2    m    y    c1   c2 #> 1  9.27 4.97 2.66 3.46 8.80  9.26 3.14 #> 2 10.79 4.13 3.33 4.05 7.37 10.71 5.80 #> 3 11.10 5.91 3.32 4.04 8.24 10.60 5.45 #> 4  9.53 4.78 2.32 3.54 8.37  9.22 3.83 #> 5 10.00 4.38 2.95 4.65 8.39  9.58 4.26 #> 6 12.25 5.81 4.04 4.73 9.65  9.51 4.01 m ~ x + w1 + w1x + c1 + c2 #> m ~ x + w1 + w1x + c1 + c2 y ~ m + w2 + w2m + x + c1 + c2 #> y ~ m + w2 + w2m + x + c1 + c2 lm_m <- lm(m ~ x*w1, dat) lm_y <- lm(y ~ m*w2 + x, dat) lm_out <- lm2list(lm_m, lm_y) # R set to 100 just for illustration. # Use 5000 or 10000 and set parallel to TRUE in real research. out_cond <- cond_indirect_effects(wlevels =c("w1", "w2"),                                   x = "x",                                   y = "y",                                   m = "m",                                   fit = lm_out,                                   standardized_x = TRUE,                                   standardized_y = TRUE,                                   boot_ci = TRUE,                                   R = 100,                                   seed = 12345,                                   parallel = FALSE,                                   progress = FALSE) out_cond #>  #> == Conditional indirect effects == #>  #>  Path: x -> m -> y #>  Conditional on moderator(s): w1, w2 #>  Moderator(s) represented by: w1, w2 #>  #>      [w1]    [w2]  (w1)  (w2)   std  CI.lo CI.hi Sig   m~x   y~m   ind #> 1 M+1.0SD M+1.0SD 6.173 4.040 0.412  0.110 0.685 Sig 0.599 0.685 0.410 #> 2 M+1.0SD M-1.0SD 6.173 2.055 0.182 -0.021 0.437     0.599 0.302 0.181 #> 3 M-1.0SD M+1.0SD 4.038 4.040 0.119 -0.089 0.393     0.173 0.685 0.118 #> 4 M-1.0SD M-1.0SD 4.038 2.055 0.052 -0.042 0.203     0.173 0.302 0.052 #>  #>  - [CI.lo to CI.hi] are 95.0% percentile confidence intervals by #>    nonparametric bootstrapping with 100 samples. #>  - std: The standardized indirect effects.  #>  - ind: The unstandardized indirect effects. #>  - 'm~x','y~m' is/are the path coefficient(s) along the path conditional #>    on the moderators. library(manymome.table) ft_cond <- as_flextable(out_cond) ft_cond

code: library(flextable) ft_cond2 <- ft_cond |>               bold(part = "header") |>               bg(i = c(1, 2), bg = "lightblue", part = "body") |>               bg(i = c(3, 4), bg = "lightgreen", part = "body") ft_cond2 save_as_docx(ft_cond, "conditional_effects.docx")

text: 'as_flextable' method output 'manymome::many_indirect_effects()'.

title: Convert an 'cond_indirect_effects' Object to a 'flextable' Object — as_flextable.cond_indirect_effects
code: # S3 method for cond_indirect_effects as_flextable(   x,   pvalue = FALSE,   se = TRUE,   var_labels = NULL,   digits = 2,   pval_digits = 3,   use_arrow = TRUE,   indirect_raw = TRUE,   indirect_raw_ci = indirect_raw,   indirect_raw_se = indirect_raw,   footnote = TRUE,   show_wvalues = TRUE,   show_indicators = FALSE,   show_path = TRUE,   pcut = 0.001,   ... )

title: Convert an 'cond_indirect_effects' Object to a 'flextable' Object — as_flextable.cond_indirect_effects
text: x object converted. class cond_indirect_effects package manymome. pvalue bootstrap confidence intervals stored, whether asymmetric p-values reported. Default FALSE. See manymome::print.cond_indirect_effects() computational details. se Whether standard errors reported confidence intervals stored. Default TRUE. See manymome::print.cond_indirect_effects() computation details. var_labels named vectors. Used replace variable names names generating table. example, c(x = ".V", y = "D.V.") replaces x ".V" y "D.V." output. digits number digits displayed numerical columns, effect estimates, standard errors, confidence intervals. Default 2. pval_digits number digits displayed p-value column, present. Default 3. use_arrow TRUE, default, use arrow symbol paths. indirect_raw TRUE, default, report unstandardized effects even standardization done. indirect_raw_ci TRUE, report confidence intervals unstandardized effects even standardization done confidence intervals stored. Default equal indirect_raw. NOTE: used now. Always FALSE. indirect_raw_se TRUE, report standard errors unstandardized effects even standardization done confidence intervals stored. Default equal indirect_raw. NOTE: used now. Always FALSE. footnote TRUE, default, add footnote(s) regarding results bottom table. show_wvalues Whether values moderators shown. code: library(manymome) library(flextable)  # List of indirect effects  dat <- data_med_mod_a lm_m <- lm(m ~ x*w + c1 + c2, dat) lm_y <- lm(y ~ m + x + c1 + c2, dat) fit_lm <- lm2list(lm_m, lm_y)  # Should set R to 5000 or 10000 in real research boot_out_lm <- do_boot(fit_lm,                        R = 100,                        seed = 54532,                        parallel = FALSE,                        progress = FALSE)  out_xmy_on_w <- cond_indirect_effects(wlevels = "w",                                       x = "x",                                       y = "y",                                       m = "m",                                       fit = fit_lm,                                       boot_ci = TRUE,                                       boot_out = boot_out_lm)  std_xmy_on_w <- cond_indirect_effects(wlevels = "w",                                       x = "x",                                       y = "y",                                       m = "m",                                       fit = fit_lm,                                       boot_ci = TRUE,                                       boot_out = boot_out_lm,                                       standardized_x = TRUE,                                       standardized_y = TRUE)  ft1 <- as_flextable(out_xmy_on_w,                     var_labels = c(w = "Moderator")) ft1 title: Convert an 'indirect_list' Object to a 'flextable' Object — as_flextable.indirect_list
text: x object converted. class indirect_list package manymome. pvalue bootstrap confidence intervals stored, whether asymmetric p-values reported. Default FALSE. See manymome::print.indirect_list() computational details. se Whether standard errors reported confidence intervals stored. Default TRUE. See manymome::print.indirect_list() computation details. var_labels named vectors. Used replace variable names names generating table. example, c(x = ".V", y = "D.V.") replaces x ".V" y "D.V." output. digits number digits displayed numerical columns, effect estimates, standard errors, confidence intervals. Default 2. pval_digits number digits displayed p-value column, present. Default 3. use_arrow TRUE, default, use arrow symbol paths. indirect_raw TRUE, default, report unstandardized effects even standardization done. indirect_raw_ci TRUE, report confidence intervals unstandardized effects even standardization done confidence intervals stored. Default equal indirect_raw. NOTE: used now. Always FALSE. indirect_raw_se TRUE, report standard errors unstandardized effects even standardization done confidence intervals stored. Default equal indirect_raw. NOTE: used now. Always FALSE. group_by_x TRUE, default, rows grouped x-variables paths one x-variable.  Default TRUE. group_by_y TRUE, default, rows grouped y-variables paths one y-variable. Default TRUE. y_first group x- y-variables, group y-variables first TRUE, default. Otherwise, group x-variables. total_indirect TRUE, default, total indirect effect computed added output. footnote TRUE, default, add footnote(s) regarding results bottom table. pcut p-value less pcut displayed <[pcut], "[pcut]" replaced value pcut. Default .001. ... Additional arguments. Ignored.

+ x2, data_med_complicated) fit <- lm2list(lm_m11, lm_m2, lm_y1)  # All indirect paths paths <- all_indirect_paths(fit,                            x = c("x1", "x2"),                            y = c("y1"))  # Indirect paths from x1 to y1 paths_x1y1 <- all_indirect_paths(fit,                            x = c("x1"),                            y = c("y1"))  # Indirect effect estimates ind <-
